snippet: “Planning and system failures” were largely responsible for cutting off millions of people from emergency 911 call centers after the derecho storm in June, the Federal Communications Commission said.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission report concludes that planning and system failures by Verizon and other communications networks were largely responsible for cutting off millions of people from emergency 911 call centers following June storm that swept the mid-Atlantic.
lead_paragraph: “Planning and system failures” were largely responsible for cutting off millions of people from emergency 911 call centers after the derecho storm in June, the Federal Communications Commission said.

headline.seo: 911 Failure in Storm Was Preventable, F.C.C. Says
headline.main: F.C.C. Says Failure of 911 in Storm Was Preventable
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Says Failure of 911 In Storm Was Preventable
